  "article_text": [
    "the _ syntactic complexity _  @xcite of a regular language is the size of its syntactic semigroup  @xcite .",
    "the _ transition semigroup _ @xmath3 of a deterministic finite automaton ( dfa ) @xmath4 is the semigroup of transformations of the state set of @xmath4 generated by the transformations induced by the input letters of @xmath4 .",
    "the transition semigroup of a minimal dfa of a language @xmath5 is isomorphic to the syntactic semigroup of @xmath5  @xcite ; hence syntactic complexity is equal to the cardinality of @xmath3 .",
    "the number @xmath0 of states of @xmath4 is known as the _ state complexity _ of the language  @xcite , and it is the same as the number of left quotients of the language .",
    "the _ syntactic complexity of a class _ of regular languages is the maximal syntactic complexity of languages in that class expressed as a function of @xmath0 .",
    "a _ right ideal _",
    "( respectively , _ left ideal _",
    ", _ two - sided ideal _ ) is a non - empty language @xmath5 over an alphabet @xmath6 such that @xmath7 ( respectively , @xmath8 , @xmath9 ) .",
    "we are interested only in regular ideals ; for reasons why they deserve to be studied see  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section  1 ) .",
    "ideals appear in pattern matching .",
    "for example , if a _",
    "text _ is a word @xmath10 over some alphabet @xmath6 , and a _ pattern _ is an arbitrary language @xmath5 over @xmath6 , then an occurrence of a pattern represented by @xmath5 in text @xmath10 is a triple @xmath11 such that @xmath12 and @xmath13 is in  @xmath5 .",
    "searching text @xmath10 for words in @xmath5 is equivalent to looking for prefixes of @xmath10 that belong to the language @xmath14 , which is the left ideal generated by @xmath5 .",
    "the syntactic complexity of right ideals was proved to be @xmath15 in  @xcite .",
    "the syntactic complexities of left and two - sided ideals were also examined in  @xcite , where it was shown that @xmath1 and @xmath16 , respectively , are lower bounds on these complexities , and it was conjectured that they are also upper bounds . in this paper",
    "we prove these conjectures .    if @xmath12 for some @xmath17 , then @xmath18 is a _ suffix _ of @xmath10 and @xmath13 is a _ factor _ of @xmath10 .",
    "a suffix of @xmath10 is also a factor of @xmath10 .",
    "a  language @xmath5 is _ suffix - closed _",
    "( respectively , _ factor - closed _ ) if @xmath19 implies that every suffix ( respectively , factor ) of @xmath10 is also in  @xmath5 .",
    "we are interested only in regular suffix- and factor - closed languages .",
    "since every left ( respectively , two - sided ) ideal is the complement of a suffix - closed ( respectively , factor - closed ) language , and syntactic complexity is preserved by complementation , our theorems also apply to suffix- and factor - closed languages , but our proofs are given for left and two - sided ideals only .",
    "the _ left quotient _ or simply _ quotient _ of a regular language @xmath5 by a word @xmath10 is denoted by @xmath20 and defined by @xmath21 .",
    "a language is regular if and only if it has a finite number of quotients .",
    "the number of quotients of @xmath5 is called its _",
    "quotient complexity_. we denote the set of quotients by @xmath22 , where @xmath23 by convention .",
    "each quotient @xmath24 can be represented also as @xmath25 , where @xmath26 is such that @xmath27 .",
    "a _ deterministic finite automaton ( dfa ) _ is a quintuple @xmath28 , where @xmath29 is a finite non - empty set of _ states _ , @xmath6 is a finite non - empty _ alphabet _ @xmath30 is the _ transition function _",
    ", @xmath31 is the _ initial _ state , and @xmath32 is the set of _ final _ states .",
    "the _ quotient dfa _ of a regular language @xmath5 with @xmath0 quotients is defined by @xmath33 , where @xmath34 if and only if @xmath35 , and @xmath36 . to simplify the notation",
    ", we use the set @xmath37 of subscripts of quotients to denote the states of @xmath4 ; then @xmath4 is denoted by @xmath38 .",
    "the quotient corresponding to @xmath39 is then @xmath40 .",
    "the quotient @xmath41 is the _ initial _ quotient .",
    "a quotient is _ final _ if it contains @xmath42 .",
    "a state @xmath43 is _ empty _ if its quotient @xmath44 is empty",
    ".    the quotient dfa of @xmath5 is isomorphic to each complete minimal dfa of @xmath5 .",
    "the number of states in the quotient dfa of @xmath5 ( the quotient complexity of @xmath5 ) is therefore equal to the state complexity of @xmath5 .    in any dfa",
    ", each letter @xmath45 defines a transformation of the set @xmath29 of @xmath0 states .",
    "let @xmath46 be the set of all @xmath47 transformations of @xmath29 ; then @xmath46 is a monoid under composition .",
    "the _ identity _",
    "transformation @xmath48 maps each element to itself . for @xmath49 , a transformation ( permutation ) @xmath50 of a set @xmath51 is a _ @xmath52-cycle _ if @xmath53 .",
    "a @xmath52-cycle is denoted by @xmath54 .",
    "if a transformation @xmath50 of @xmath29 acts like a @xmath52-cycle on some @xmath55 , we say that @xmath50 has a @xmath52-cycle .",
    "a  transformation has a _ cycle _ if it has a @xmath52-cycle for some @xmath49 .",
    "a  2-cycle @xmath56 is called a _ transposition_. a transformation is _ constant _ if it maps all states to a single state @xmath43 ; it is denoted by @xmath57 . if @xmath10 is a word of @xmath58 , the fact that @xmath10 induces transformation @xmath50 is denoted by @xmath59 .",
    "a  transformation mapping @xmath60 to @xmath61 for @xmath62 is sometimes denoted by @xmath63 $ ] .",
    "let @xmath64 , let @xmath65 be a minimal dfa , and let @xmath66 be its transition semigroup . consider the sequence @xmath67 of states obtained by applying transformation @xmath68 repeatedly , starting with the initial state . since @xmath29 is finite ,",

    "next we prove that @xmath136 is the only transition semigroup meeting the bound .",
    "it follows that minimal dfas of left ideals with the maximal syntactic complexity have maximal - length chains of length @xmath297 .",

    "thus only @xmath299 reaches the bound in this case .",
    "assume now that the length of a maximal - length chain is at least 3 .",

    "it remains to be shown that there is no transformation @xmath68 such that @xmath308 . the proof that @xmath93 is different from the transformations @xmath161 of cases  1 , 2 , 3(a ) and 3(b ) is exactly the same as the corresponding proof in case  3(c ) following the definition of @xmath93 .",

    "recall that states @xmath157 and @xmath96 satisfying @xmath300 have been fixed by assumption . by the definition of @xmath93",

  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we solve two open problems concerning syntactic complexity . </S>",
    "<S> we prove that the cardinality of the syntactic semigroup of a left ideal or a suffix - closed language with @xmath0 left quotients ( that is , with state complexity @xmath0 ) is at most @xmath1 , and that of a two - sided ideal or a factor - closed language is at most @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> since these bounds are known to be reachable , this settles the problems .    </S>",
    "<S> * keywords : * factor - closed , left ideal , regular language , suffix - closed , syntactic complexity , transition semigroup , two - sided ideal , upper bound </S>"
  ]
}
